pain_points.description: Difficulty finding events with available spots.
supporting_quotes: I think it would be helpful to know which events still have openings or have it blocked out or something like that.
when I go into it, it's like most things actually that I'm interested in, I'll go in and then it says, Oh, you have to be on the wait list.
pain_points.frequency_severity: High - Frequently mentioned and expresses frustration.
pain_points.current_workarounds: None specified; user stops looking at the website when faced with too many waitlisted events.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Leads to frustration and disengagement from the website.

supporting_quotes: I think it creates extra, like, it sucks up more time for it causes more work for everybody.
I just want to hit cancel if it turns out I can't make something.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Moderate - Clearly bothers the user but is not the primary focus.
pain_points.current_workarounds: User has to find the organizer's email and manually notify them.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Increases effort and time spent on managing event attendance.

pain_points.description: Navigation and organization issues on the website.
supporting_quotes: the heading, the activity committees takes up, it's a huge bar that takes up a lot of space.
there's only two items in the hamburger menu and then there's seven top tier like top list items, which is a lot.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Moderate - Mentioned multiple times but not as emotionally charged.
pain_points.current_workarounds: User adapts by mainly using the events tab.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Makes it more difficult to find relevant information quickly.

pain_points.description: Lack of awareness about certain groups or events for specific demographics.
supporting_quotes: I was not aware of the 20 to 40 somethings committee.
it's clear that this is the thing to meet new people.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Low - Mentioned but does not seem to affect user experience significantly.
pain_points.current_workarounds: User relies on events tab for engagement with the community.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Potential missed opportunities to engage with a demographic.

pain_points.description: Unnecessary information presented to current members.
supporting_quotes: I don't go to the page... it doesn't really serve much purpose for me.
I think we already know we want to join because we want to meet people.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Low - User does not feel strongly about this issue.
pain_points.current_workarounds: User simply ignores tabs that don't serve a purpose.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Leads to a feeling of clutter and wasted time.
